section_text: 1 This Act may be cited for all purposes as The Intestates Widows and Children (Scotland) Act, 1875.
2 This Act shall extend to Scotland only.

section_title: Where estate does not exceed  £36,000  widow or children may apply to commissary clerk to fill up inventory and expede confirmation.
section_text: 3 Where  the whole estate of an intestate is of a value not exceeding ;  £36,000  an applicant for confirmation thereto  may apply to the commissary clerk of the county within which the intestate was domiciled at the time of death; and the said commissary clerk shall prepare and fill up an inventory and relative  declaration , as nearly as may be in the form of Schedule A. appended to this Act, and  on the inventory and declaration being signed by the applicant  , and  without requiring the applicant to find caution  shall proceed to record said inventory and expede confirmation in the form as nearly as may be of Schedule B. annexed to this Act, and shall deliver the same to the applicant  on payment of the requisite fee  : . . .  ; and such confirmation shall have the same force and effect as that prescribed in Schedule D. annexed to the  Confirmation of Executors (Scotland) Act, 1858 . . .

section_title: Proof of identity and relationship may be required.
section_text: 4 The commissary clerk of the county may require such proof as he may think sufficient to establish the identity and relationship of the applicant.

section_title: Commissary clerk may refuse to proceed if not satisfied that whole estate not more than 150 l .
section_text: 5 If the commissary clerk of the county has reason to believe that  the estate and effects of which the intestate died possessed exceed  the value  specified in section three of this Act  , he shall refuse to proceed with the application until he is satisfied as to the real value thereof.

section_title: Commissary clerk may administer oath.   “Commissary clerk” to include  “commissary clerk depute.”
section_text: 6 . . . The term “commissary clerk” shall throughout this Act include “commissary clerk depute.”

section_title: Procedure and fees under this Act to be regulated by Act of sederunt.
section_text: 7 Any rules and orders and tables of fees requisite for carrying this Act into operation shall be framed and may from time to time be altered by the Court of Session by act of sederunt . . .  .

section_title: Inventory duty not affected by this Act.
section_text: 8 Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall be construed to effect any duty now payable on inventories of personal estate.
